Element: Read all of this leaflet carefully before you start taking this medicine because it contains important information for you.

Element: · This medicine has been prescribed for you only. Do not pass it on to others. It may harm them, even if their signs of illness are the same as yours.
Text: ·         This medicine has been prescribed for you only. Do not pass it on to others. It may harm them, even if their signs of illness are the same as yours.

Element: 1. What Kalydeco is and what it is used for
Text: 1.              What Kalydeco is and what it is used for

Element: Kalydeco contains the active ingredient ivacaftor. Ivacaftor acts at the level of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR), a protein that forms a channel at the cell surface that allows the movement of particles such as chloride in and out of the cell. Due to mutations in the CFTR gene (see below), chloride movement is reduced in those with cystic fibrosis (CF). Ivacaftor helps certain abnormal CFTR proteins open more often to improve chloride movement in and out of the cell.
Text: Kalydeco contains the active ingredient ivacaftor. Ivacaftor acts at the level of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR), a protein that forms a channel at the cell surface that allows the movement of particles such as chloride in and out of the cell. Due to mutations in the CFTR gene (see below), chloride movement is reduced in those with cystic fibrosis (CF). Ivacaftor helps certain abnormal CFTR proteins open more often to improve chloride movement in and out of the cell.

Element: Kalydeco tablets are indicated:
Text: Kalydeco tablets are indicated:

Element: · As monotherapy for patients aged 6 years and older and weighing 25 kg or more with cystic fibrosis (CF) who have an R117H CFTR mutation or one of the following gating mutations in the CFTR gene: G551D, G1244E, G1349D, G178R, G551S, S1251N, S1255P, S549N or S549R.
Text: ·         As monotherapy for patients aged 6 years and older and weighing 25 kg or more with cystic fibrosis (CF) who have an R117H CFTR mutation or one of the following gating mutations in the CFTR gene: G551D, G1244E, G1349D, G178R, G551S, S1251N, S1255P, S549N or S549R.

Element: · In combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor tablets for patients aged 12 years and older with CF who have two F508del mutations in the CFTR gene (homozygous for the F508del mutation) or who have an F508del mutation and certain other second mutations (heterozygous for the F508del mutation). If you have been prescribed Kalydeco to be taken with tezacaftor/ivacaftor, read the tezacaftor/ivacaftor package leaflet. It contains important information about how to take these two medicines.
Text: ·         In combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor tablets for patients aged 12 years and older with CF who have two F508del mutations in the CFTR gene (homozygous for the F508del mutation) or who have an F508del mutation and certain other second mutations (heterozygous for the F508del mutation). If you have been prescribed Kalydeco to be taken with tezacaftor/ivacaftor, read the tezacaftor/ivacaftor package leaflet. It contains important information about how to take these two medicines.

Element: · In combination with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor tablets for patients aged 12 years and over with CF who are homozygous for the F508del mutation in the CFTR gene or heterozygous for F508del in the CFTR gene with a minimal function (MF) mutation. A minimal function mutation is defined as one that results either in no CFTR protein being produced or a CFTR protein that does not function, and which is unlikely to respond to ivacaftor alone and tezacaftor/ivacaftor. If you have been prescribed Kalydeco to be taken with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor, read the ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor package leaflet. It contains important information about how to take these two medicines.
Text: ·         In combination with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor tablets for patients aged 12 years and over with CF who are homozygous for the F508del mutation in the CFTR gene or heterozygous for F508del in the CFTR gene with a minimal function (MF) mutation. A minimal function mutation is defined as one that results either in no CFTR protein being produced or a CFTR protein that does not function, and which is unlikely to respond to ivacaftor alone and tezacaftor/ivacaftor. If you have been prescribed Kalydeco to be taken with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor, read the ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor package leaflet. It contains important information about how to take these two medicines.

Element: 2. What you need to know before you take Kalydeco
Text: 2.              What you need to know before you take Kalydeco

Element: Do not take Kalydeco
Text: Do not take Kalydeco

Element: · if you are allergic to ivacaftor or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6).
Text: ·         if you are allergic to ivacaftor or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6).

Element: Warnings and precautions
Text: Warnings and precautions

Element: · Talk to your doctor if you have liver problems or have previously had them. Your doctor may need to adjust your dose.
Text: ·         Talk to your doctor if you have liver problems or have previously had them. Your doctor may need to adjust your dose.

Element: · Increased liver enzymes in the blood have been seen in some people receiving Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor). Tell your doctor right away if you have any of these symptoms, which may be a sign of liver problems:
Text: ·         Increased liver enzymes in the blood have been seen in some people receiving Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor). Tell your doctor right away if you have any of these symptoms, which may be a sign of liver problems:

Element: · Pain or discomfort in the upper right stomach (abdominal) area
Text: ·         Pain or discomfort in the upper right stomach (abdominal) area

Element: · Yellowing of the skin or the white part of the eyes
Text: ·         Yellowing of the skin or the white part of the eyes

Element: · Loss of appetite
Text: ·         Loss of appetite

Element: · Nausea or vomiting
Text: ·         Nausea or vomiting

Element: · Dark urine
Text: ·         Dark urine

Element: Your doctor will do some blood tests to check your liver before and during treatment, particularly during the first year and especially if your blood tests showed high liver enzymes in the past.
Text: Your doctor will do some blood tests to check your liver before and during treatment, particularly during the first year and especially if your blood tests showed high liver enzymes in the past.

Element: · Talk to your doctor if you have kidney problems or have previously had them.
Text: ·         Talk to your doctor if you have kidney problems or have previously had them.

Element: · Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor) is not recommended if you have undergone an organ transplant.
Text: ·         Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor) is not recommended if you have undergone an organ transplant.

Element: · Talk to your doctor if you are using hormonal contraception – for example, women using the contraceptive pill. This may mean you are more likely to get a rash while taking Kalydeco in combination with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor.
Text: ·         Talk to your doctor if you are using hormonal contraception – for example, women using the contraceptive pill. This may mean you are more likely to get a rash while taking Kalydeco in combination with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor.

Element: · Abnormality of the eye lens (cataract) without any effect on vision has been noted in some children and adolescents treated with Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor). Your doctor may perform some eye examinations prior to and during treatment.
Text: ·         Abnormality of the eye lens (cataract) without any effect on vision has been noted in some children and adolescents treated with Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor). Your doctor may perform some eye examinations prior to and during treatment.

Element: · Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor) should only be used if you have one of the mutations in the CFTR gene indicated in section 1 (What Kalydeco is and what it is used for).
Text: ·         Kalydeco (alone or in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor) should only be used if you have one of the mutations in the CFTR gene indicated in section 1 (What Kalydeco is and what it is used for).

Element: Children and adolescents
Text: Children and adolescents

Element: Do not give this medicine to children under 4 months of age as it is not known if ivacaftor is safe and effective in these children.
Text: Do not give this medicine to children under 4 months of age as it is not known if ivacaftor is safe and effective in these children.

Element: Do not give this medicine in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor to children under 12 years of age as it is not known if they are safe and effective for them.
Text: Do not give this medicine in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor or with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor to children under 12 years of age as it is not known if they are safe and effective for them.

Element: Other medicines and Kalydeco
Text: Other medicines and Kalydeco

Element: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are using, have recently used or might use any other medicines. Some medicines can affect how Kalydeco works or make side effects more likely. In particular, tell your doctor if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. Your doctor may decide to adjust your dose or that you need extra check-ups.
Text: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are using, have recently used or might use any other medicines. Some medicines can affect how Kalydeco works or make side effects more likely. In particular, tell your doctor if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. Your doctor may decide to adjust your dose or that you need extra check-ups.

Element: · Antifungal medicines (used for the treatment of fungal infections). These include fluconazole, itraconazole, ketoconazole, posaconazole, and voriconazole.
Text: ·         Antifungal medicines (used for the treatment of fungal infections). These include fluconazole, itraconazole, ketoconazole, posaconazole, and voriconazole.

Element: · Antibiotic medicines (used for the treatment of bacterial infections). These include clarithromycin, erythromycin, rifabutin, rifampicin, and telithromycin .
Text: ·         Antibiotic medicines (used for the treatment of bacterial infections). These include clarithromycin, erythromycin, rifabutin, rifampicin, and telithromycin .

Element: · Epilepsy medicines (used for the treatment of epileptic seizures). These include carbamazepine, phenobarbital, and phenytoin.
Text: ·         Epilepsy medicines (used for the treatment of epileptic seizures). These include carbamazepine, phenobarbital, and phenytoin.

Element: · Herbal medicines. These include St. John’s wort (Hypericum perforatum).
Text: ·         Herbal medicines. These include St. John’s wort (Hypericum perforatum).

Element: · Immunosuppressants (used after an organ transplantation). These include ciclosporin, everolimus, sirolimus, and tacrolimus, .
Text: ·         Immunosuppressants (used after an organ transplantation). These include ciclosporin, everolimus, sirolimus, and tacrolimus, .

Element: · Cardiac glycosides (used for the treatment of some heart conditions). These include digoxin.
Text: ·         Cardiac glycosides (used for the treatment of some heart conditions). These include digoxin.

Element: · Anticoagulant medicines (used to prevent blood clots). These include warfarin.
Text: ·         Anticoagulant medicines (used to prevent blood clots). These include warfarin.

Element: · Medicines for diabetes. These include glimepiride and glipizide.
Text: ·         Medicines for diabetes. These include glimepiride and glipizide.

Element: · Medicines for lowering blood pressure. These include verapamil.
Text: ·         Medicines for lowering blood pressure. These include verapamil.

Element: Kalydeco with food and drink
Text: Kalydeco with food and drink

Element: Avoid food or drink containing grapefruit during treatment with Kalydeco as they may increase the side effects of Kalydeco by increasing the amount of ivacaftor in your body.
Text: Avoid food or drink containing grapefruit during treatment with Kalydeco as they may increase the side effects of Kalydeco by increasing the amount of ivacaftor in your body.

Element: Pregnancy and breast-feeding
Text: Pregnancy and breast-feeding

Element: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor for advice before taking this medicine. It may be better to avoid using Kalydeco during pregnancy, if possible, and your doctor will help you decide what is best for you and your child.
Text: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor for advice before taking this medicine. It may be better to avoid using Kalydeco during pregnancy, if possible, and your doctor will help you decide what is best for you and your child.

Element: It is unknown whether ivacaftor is excreted in human milk. If you plan to breast-feed, ask your doctor for advice before taking Kalydeco. Your doctor will decide whether to recommend that you stop breast-feeding or for you to stop ivacaftor therapy. Your doctor will take into account the benefit of breast-feeding for the child and the benefit of therapy for you.
Text: It is unknown whether ivacaftor is excreted in human milk. If you plan to breast-feed, ask your doctor for advice before taking Kalydeco. Your doctor will decide whether to recommend that you stop breast-feeding or for you to stop ivacaftor therapy. Your doctor will take into account the benefit of breast-feeding for the child and the benefit of therapy for you.

Element: Driving and using machines
Text: Driving and using machines

Element: Kalydeco can make you dizzy. If you feel dizzy, do not drive, cycle or use machines.
Text: Kalydeco can make you dizzy. If you feel dizzy, do not drive, cycle or use machines.

Element: Important information about the contents of Kalydeco
Text: Important information about the contents of Kalydeco

Element: Kalydeco contains lactose. If you have been told by your doctor that you have an intolerance to some sugars, contact your doctor before taking this medicine.
Text: Kalydeco contains lactose. If you have been told by your doctor that you have an intolerance to some sugars, contact your doctor before taking this medicine.

Element: Kalydeco contains less than 1 mmol sodium (23 mg) per dose, that is to say essentially ‘sodium‑free’.
Text: Kalydeco contains less than 1 mmol sodium (23 mg) per dose, that is to say essentially ‘sodium‑free’.

Element: 3. How to take Kalydeco
Text: 3.              How to take Kalydeco

Element: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor has told you to. Check with your doctor if you are not sure.
Text: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor has told you to. Check with your doctor if you are not sure.

Element: Your doctor will determine which medicine and dose is right for you.
Text: Your doctor will determine which medicine and dose is right for you.

Element: Kalydeco dosing recommendations are provided in Table 1.
Text: Kalydeco dosing recommendations are provided in Table 1.

Element: Table 1: Dosing recommendations
Text: Table 1: Dosing recommendations

Element:
Morning

Evening

Kalydeco as monotherapy

6 years and older, ≥25 kg

One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet

One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet

Kalydeco in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor

12 years and older

One tezacaftor 100 mg/ivacaftor 150 mg tablet

One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet

Kalydeco in combination with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor

12 years and older

Two ivacaftor 75 mg/tezacaftor 50 mg/elexacaftor 100 mg tablets

One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet
Text: Morning   Evening     Kalydeco as monotherapy     6 years and older, ≥25 kg   One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet   One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet     Kalydeco in combination with tezacaftor/ivacaftor     12 years and older   One tezacaftor 100 mg/ivacaftor 150 mg tablet   One Kalydeco 150 mg tablet     Kalydeco in combination with ivacaftor/tezacaftor/elexacaftor     12 years and older   Two ivacaftor 75 mg/tezacaftor   50 mg/elexacaftor 100 mg tablets   One Kalydeco 150 mg   tablet

Element: Take the tablets morning and evening doses approximately 12 hours apart with food that contains fat.
Text: Take the tablets morning and evening doses approximately 12 hours apart with food that contains fat.

Element: You must keep using all other medicines you use, unless your doctor tells you to stop using any.
Text: You must keep using all other medicines you use, unless your doctor tells you to stop using any.

Element: If you have liver problems, either moderate or severe, your doctor may need to reduce the dose of your tablets, because your liver will not clear the medicine as fast as in people who have normal liver function.
Text: If you have liver problems, either moderate or severe, your doctor may need to reduce the dose of your tablets, because your liver will not clear the medicine as fast as in people who have normal liver function.

Element: Use in children
Text: Use in children

Element: Other forms of this medicine (granules in sachet) are more suitable for children under 6 years of age; ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Text: Other forms of this medicine (granules in sachet) are more suitable for children under 6 years of age; ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Element: This medicine is for oral use.
Text: This medicine is for oral use.

Element: Swallow the tablet whole. Do not break, chew or dissolve the tablets. Take Kalydeco tablets with food that contains fat.
Text: Swallow the tablet whole. Do not break, chew or dissolve the tablets. Take Kalydeco tablets with food that contains fat.

Element: Meals or snacks that contain fat include those prepared with butter or oils or those containing eggs. Other fat-containing foods are:
Text: Meals or snacks that contain fat include those prepared with butter or oils or those containing eggs. Other fat-containing foods are:

Element: · Cheese, whole milk, whole-milk dairy products, yogurt, chocolate
Text: ·         Cheese, whole milk, whole-milk dairy products, yogurt, chocolate

Element: · Meats, oily fish
Text: ·         Meats, oily fish

Element: · Avocados, hummus, soy-based products (tofu)
Text: ·         Avocados, hummus, soy-based products (tofu)

Element: · Nuts, fat-containing nutritional bars or drinks
Text: ·         Nuts, fat-containing nutritional bars or drinks

Element: If you take more Kalydeco than you should
Text: If you take more Kalydeco than you should

Element: You may experience side effects, including those mentioned in section 4 below. If so, contact your doctor or pharmacist to ask for advice. If possible, have your medicine and this leaflet with you.
Text: You may experience side effects, including those mentioned in section 4 below. If so, contact your doctor or pharmacist to ask for advice. If possible, have your medicine and this leaflet with you.

Element: If you forget to take Kalydeco
Text: If you forget to take Kalydeco

Element: Take the missed dose if less than 6 hours have passed since the time you missed the dose. Otherwise, wait until your next scheduled dose as you normally would. Do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.
Text: Take the missed dose if less than 6 hours have passed since the time you missed the dose. Otherwise, wait until your next scheduled dose as you normally would. Do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.

Element: If you stop taking Kalydeco
Text: If you stop taking Kalydeco

Element: Take Kalydeco for as long as your doctor recommends. Do not stop unless your doctor advises you to. If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Text: Take Kalydeco for as long as your doctor recommends. Do not stop unless your doctor advises you to. If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.         Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

Element: Serious side effects
Text: Serious side effects

Element: Stomach (abdominal) ache and increased liver enzymes in the blood.
Text: Stomach (abdominal) ache and increased liver enzymes in the blood.

Element: Possible signs of liver problems
Text: Possible signs of liver problems

Element: Increased liver enzymes in the blood are common in patients with CF. These may be signs of liver problems:
Text: Increased liver enzymes in the blood are common in patients with CF. These may be signs of liver problems:

Element: · Pain or discomfort in the upper right area of the stomach (abdominal) area
Text: ·         Pain or discomfort in the upper right area of the stomach (abdominal) area

Element: · Yellowing of the skin or white part of the eyes
Text: ·         Yellowing of the skin or white part of the eyes

Element: · Loss of appetite
Text: ·         Loss of appetite

Element: · Nausea or vomiting
Text: ·         Nausea or vomiting

Element: · Dark urine
Text: ·         Dark urine

Element: Tell your doctor straight away if you get any of these.
Text: Tell your doctor straight away if you get any of these.

Element: Very common side effects (may affect more than 1 in 10 people)
Text: Very common side effects (may affect more than 1 in 10 people)

Element: · Upper respiratory tract infection (the common cold), including sore throat and nasal congestion
Text: ·         Upper respiratory tract infection (the common cold), including sore throat and nasal congestion

Element: · Headache
Text: ·         Headache

Element: · Dizziness
Text: ·         Dizziness

Element: · Diarrhoea
Text: ·         Diarrhoea

Element: · Stomach or abdominal pain
Text: ·         Stomach or abdominal pain

Element: · Changes in the type of bacteria in mucus
Text: ·         Changes in the type of bacteria in mucus

Element: · Increased liver enzymes (signs of stress on the liver)
Text: ·         Increased liver enzymes (signs of stress on the liver)

Element: · Rash
Text: ·         Rash

Element: Common side effects (may affect up to 1 in 10 people)
Text: Common side effects (may affect up to 1 in 10 people)

Element: · Runny nose
Text: ·         Runny nose

Element: · Ear pain, ear discomfort
Text: ·         Ear pain, ear discomfort

Element: · Ringing in the ears
Text: ·         Ringing in the ears

Element: · Redness inside the ear
Text: ·         Redness inside the ear

Element: · Inner ear disorder (feeling dizzy or spinning)
Text: ·         Inner ear disorder (feeling dizzy or spinning)

Element: · Sinus problems (sinus congestion)
Text: ·         Sinus problems (sinus congestion)

Element: · Redness in the throat
Text: ·         Redness in the throat

Element: · Breast mass
Text: ·         Breast mass

Element: · Feeling sick (nausea)
Text: ·         Feeling sick (nausea)

Element: · Flu
Text: ·         Flu

Element: · Low blood sugar (hypoglycaemia)
Text: ·         Low blood sugar (hypoglycaemia)

Element: · Abnormal breathing (shortness of breath or difficulty breathing)
Text: ·         Abnormal breathing (shortness of breath or difficulty breathing)

Element: · Wind (flatulence)
Text: ·         Wind (flatulence)

Element: · Spots (acne)
Text: ·         Spots (acne)

Element: · Itchy skin
Text: ·         Itchy skin

Element: · Increased creatine phosphokinase (sign of muscle breakdown) seen in blood tests
Text: ·         Increased creatine phosphokinase (sign of muscle breakdown) seen in blood tests

Element: Uncommon side effects (may affect up to 1 in 100 people)
Text: Uncommon side effects (may affect up to 1 in 100 people)

Element: · Ear congestion
Text: ·         Ear congestion

Element: · Breast inflammation
Text: ·         Breast inflammation

Element: · Enlargement of the breast in males
Text: ·         Enlargement of the breast in males

Element: · Nipple changes or pain
Text: ·         Nipple changes or pain

Element: · Wheezing
Text: ·         Wheezing

Element: · Increased blood pressure
Text: ·         Increased blood pressure

Element: Additional side effects in children and adolescents
Text: Additional side effects in children and adolescents

Element: Side effects seen in children and adolescents are similar to those observed in adults. However, increased liver enzymes in the blood are more frequently seen in young children.
Text: Side effects seen in children and adolescents are similar to those observed in adults. However, increased liver enzymes in the blood are more frequently seen in young children.

Element: Reporting of side effects
Text: Reporting of side effects

Element: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor or pharmacist. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.
Text: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor or pharmacist. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Kalydeco
Text: 5.                   How to store Kalydeco

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the package after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the package after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: This medicine does not require any special storage conditions.
Text: This medicine does not require any special storage conditions.

Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.
Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.

Element: 6. Contents of the pack and other information
Text: 6.       Contents of the pack and other information

Element: What Kalydeco contains
Text: What Kalydeco contains

Element: The active substance is ivacaftor. Each film‑coated tablet contains 150 mg of ivacaftor.
Text: The active substance is ivacaftor. Each film‑coated tablet contains 150 mg of ivacaftor.

Element: The other ingredients are:
Text: The other ingredients are:

Element: · Tablet core: cellulose microcrystalline, lactose monohydrate, hypromellose acetate succinate, croscarmellose sodium, sodium laurilsulfate (E487), silica, colloidal anhydrous, and magnesium stearate.
Text: ·      Tablet core: cellulose microcrystalline, lactose monohydrate, hypromellose acetate succinate, croscarmellose sodium, sodium laurilsulfate (E487), silica, colloidal anhydrous, and magnesium stearate.

Element: · Coating: polyvinyl alcohol, titanium dioxide (E171), macrogol (PEG 3350), talc, indigo carmine aluminium lake (E132) and carnauba wax.
Text: ·      Coating: polyvinyl alcohol, titanium dioxide (E171), macrogol (PEG 3350), talc, indigo carmine aluminium lake (E132) and carnauba wax.

Element: · Printing ink: shellac, iron oxide black (E172), propylene glycol (E1520) and ammonia solution, concentrated.
Text: ·      Printing ink: shellac, iron oxide black (E172), propylene glycol (E1520) and ammonia solution, concentrated.

Element: See the end of section 2 - Important information about the contents of Kalydeco.
Text: See the end of section 2 - Important information about the contents of Kalydeco.

Element: What Kalydeco looks like and contents of the pack
Text: What Kalydeco looks like and contents of the pack

Element: Kalydeco 150 mg film-coated tablets are light blue, capsule‑shaped, 16.5 mm x 8.4 mm, and printed with “V 150” in black ink on one side and plain on the other.
Text: Kalydeco 150 mg film-coated tablets are light blue, capsule‑shaped, 16.5 mm x 8.4 mm, and printed with “V 150” in black ink on one side and plain on the other.

Element: Kalydeco is available in the following pack sizes:
Text: Kalydeco is available in the following pack sizes:

Element: · Blister card pack containing 28 film‑coated tablets

Element: 1. What Kalydeco is and what it is used for
Text: 1.              What Kalydeco is and what it is used for

Element: Kalydeco contains the active ingredient ivacaftor. Ivacaftor acts at the level of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR), a protein that forms a channel at the cell surface that allows the movement of particles such as chloride in and out of the cell. Due to mutations in the CFTR gene (see below), chloride movement is reduced in those with cystic fibrosis (CF). Ivacaftor helps certain abnormal CFTR proteins open more often to improve chloride movement in and out of the cell.
Text: Kalydeco contains the active ingredient ivacaftor. Ivacaftor acts at the level of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR), a protein that forms a channel at the cell surface that allows the movement of particles such as chloride in and out of the cell. Due to mutations in the CFTR gene (see below), chloride movement is reduced in those with cystic fibrosis (CF). Ivacaftor helps certain abnormal CFTR proteins open more often to improve chloride movement in and out of the cell.

Element: Kalydeco granules are indicated for the treatment of babies and children aged 4 months and older and weighing 5 kg to less than 25 kg with cystic fibrosis (CF) who have an R117H CFTR mutation or one of the following gating mutations in the CFTR gene: G551D, G1244E, G1349D, G178R, G551S, S1251N, S1255P, S549N or S549R.
Text: Kalydeco granules are indicated for the treatment of babies and children aged 4 months and older and weighing 5 kg to less than 25 kg with cystic fibrosis (CF) who have an R117H CFTR mutation or one of the following gating mutations in the CFTR gene: G551D, G1244E, G1349D, G178R, G551S, S1251N, S1255P, S549N or S549R.

Element: 2. What you need to know before your child takes Kalydeco
Text: 2.              What you need to know before your child takes Kalydeco

Element: Do not take Kalydeco
Text: Do not take Kalydeco

Element: · if your child is allergic to ivacaftor or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6).
Text: ·         if your child is allergic to ivacaftor or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6).

Element: Warnings and precautions
Text: Warnings and precautions

Element: · Talk to your child’s doctor if your child has liver problems or has had them previously. Your child’s doctor may need to adjust your child’s dose.
Text: ·         Talk to your child’s doctor if your child has liver problems or has had them previously. Your child’s doctor may need to adjust your child’s dose.

Element: · Increased liver enzymes in the blood have been seen in some people receiving Kalydeco. Tell your child’s doctor right away if your child has any of these symptoms, which may be a sign of liver problems:
Text: ·         Increased liver enzymes in the blood have been seen in some people receiving Kalydeco. Tell your child’s doctor right away if your child has any of these symptoms, which may be a sign of liver problems:

Element: · Pain or discomfort in the upper right stomach (abdominal) area
Text: ·         Pain or discomfort in the upper right stomach (abdominal) area

Element: · Yellowing of the skin or the white part of the eyes
Text: ·         Yellowing of the skin or the white part of the eyes

Element: · Loss of appetite
Text: ·         Loss of appetite

Element: · Nausea or vomiting
Text: ·         Nausea or vomiting

Element: · Dark urine
Text: ·         Dark urine

Element: Your child’s doctor will do some blood tests to check your child’s liver before and during treatment, particularly during the first year and especially if blood tests showed high liver enzymes in the past.
Text: Your child’s doctor will do some blood tests to check your child’s liver before and during treatment, particularly during the first year and especially if blood tests showed high liver enzymes in the past.

Element: · Talk to your child’s doctor if you have been told your child has kidney problems or has previously had them.
Text: ·         Talk to your child’s doctor if you have been told your child has kidney problems or has previously had them.

Element: · Kalydeco is not recommended for patients who have undergone an organ transplant.
Text: ·         Kalydeco is not recommended for patients who have undergone an organ transplant.

Element: · Abnormality of the eye lens (cataract) without any effect on vision has been noted in some children and adolescents during treatment.
Text: ·         Abnormality of the eye lens (cataract) without any effect on vision has been noted in some children and adolescents during treatment.

Element: Your child’s doctor may perform some eye examinations prior to and during treatment with ivacaftor.
Text: Your child’s doctor may perform some eye examinations prior to and during treatment with ivacaftor.

Element: Children
Text: Children

Element: Do not give this medicine to children under 4 months of age as it is not known if ivacaftor is safe and effective in these children.
Text: Do not give this medicine to children under 4 months of age as it is not known if ivacaftor is safe and effective in these children.

Element: Other medicines and Kalydeco
Text: Other medicines and Kalydeco

Element: Tell your child’s doctor or pharmacist if your child is using, has recently used or might use any other medicines. Some medicines can affect how Kalydeco works or make side effects more likely. In particular, tell your child’s doctor if your child is taking any of the medicines listed below. Your child’s doctor may decide to adjust your child’s dose or if extra check-ups are needed.
Text: Tell your child’s doctor or pharmacist if your child is using, has recently used or might use any other medicines. Some medicines can affect how Kalydeco works or make side effects more likely. In particular, tell your child’s doctor if your child is taking any of the medicines listed below. Your child’s doctor may decide to adjust your child’s dose or if extra check-ups are needed.

Element: · Antifungal medicines (used for the treatment of fungal infections). These include fluconazole, itraconazole, ketoconazole, posaconazole, and voriconazole.
Text: ·         Antifungal medicines (used for the treatment of fungal infections). These include fluconazole, itraconazole, ketoconazole, posaconazole, and voriconazole.

Element: · Antibiotic medicines (used for the treatment of bacterial infections). These include, clarithromycin, erythromycin, rifabutin, rifampicin and telithromycin.
Text: ·         Antibiotic medicines (used for the treatment of bacterial infections). These include, clarithromycin, erythromycin, rifabutin, rifampicin and telithromycin.

Element: · Epilepsy medicines (used for the treatment of epileptic seizures or fits). These include carbamazepine, phenobarbital, and phenytoin.
Text: ·         Epilepsy medicines (used for the treatment of epileptic seizures or fits). These include carbamazepine, phenobarbital, and phenytoin.

Element: · Herbal medicines. These include St. John’s wort (Hypericum perforatum).
Text: ·         Herbal medicines. These include St. John’s wort (Hypericum perforatum).

Element: · Immunosuppressants (used after an organ transplantation). These include ciclosporin, everolimus, sirolimus, and tacrolimus.
Text: ·         Immunosuppressants (used after an organ transplantation). These include ciclosporin, everolimus, sirolimus, and tacrolimus.

Element: · Cardiac glycosides (used for the treatment of some heart conditions). These include digoxin.
Text: ·         Cardiac glycosides (used for the treatment of some heart conditions). These include digoxin.

Element: · Anticoagulant medicines (used to prevent blood clots). These include warfarin.
Text: ·         Anticoagulant medicines (used to prevent blood clots). These include warfarin.

Element: · Medicines for diabetes. These include glimepiride and glipizide.
Text: ·         Medicines for diabetes. These include glimepiride and glipizide.

Element: · Medicines for lowering blood pressure. These include verapamil.
Text: ·         Medicines for lowering blood pressure. These include verapamil.

Element: Kalydeco with food and drink
Text: Kalydeco with food and drink

Element: Avoid giving your child food or drink containing grapefruit during treatment with Kalydeco as they may increase the side effects of Kalydeco by increasing the amount of ivacaftor in your child’s body.
Text: Avoid giving your child food or drink containing grapefruit during treatment with Kalydeco as they may increase the side effects of Kalydeco by increasing the amount of ivacaftor in your child’s body.

Element: Driving and using machines
Text: Driving and using machines

Element: Kalydeco can make your child dizzy. If your child feels dizzy, it is advised that your child does not ride his/her bike or do anything else that needs his/her full attention.
Text: Kalydeco can make your child dizzy. If your child feels dizzy, it is advised that your child does not ride his/her bike or do anything else that needs his/her full attention.

Element: Important information about the contents of Kalydeco
Text: Important information about the contents of Kalydeco

Element: Kalydeco contains lactose. If you have been told by your child’s doctor that your child has an intolerance to some sugars, contact your child’s doctor before your child takes this medicine.
Text: Kalydeco contains lactose. If you have been told by your child’s doctor that your child has an intolerance to some sugars, contact your child’s doctor before your child takes this medicine.

Element: Kalydeco contains less than 1 mmol sodium (23 mg) per dose, that is to say essentially ‘sodium‑free’.
Text: Kalydeco contains less than 1 mmol sodium (23 mg) per dose, that is to say essentially ‘sodium‑free’.

Element: 3. How to take Kalydeco
Text: 3.              How to take Kalydeco

Element: Always give your child this medicine exactly as your child’s doctor has told you to. Check with your child’s doctor if you are not sure.
Text: Always give your child this medicine exactly as your child’s doctor has told you to. Check with your child’s doctor if you are not sure.

Element: Your child’s doctor will determine the correct dose for your child. Your child must keep using all other medicines, unless your child’s doctor tells him/her to stop using any.
Text: Your child’s doctor will determine the correct dose for your child. Your child must keep using all other medicines, unless your child’s doctor tells him/her to stop using any.

Element: Kalydeco dosing recommendations are provided in Table 1.
Text: Kalydeco dosing recommendations are provided in Table 1.

Element: Table 1: Dosing recommendations for children aged 4 months and older
Text: Table 1: Dosing recommendations for children aged 4 months and older

Element:

Text: Age   Weight   Dose   Total daily dose     4 months to less than 6 months   5 kg or more   One sachet of 25 mg granules taken orally every 12 hours   with fat‑containing food   50 mg     6 months and older   5 kg to less than 7 kg   One Kalydeco sachet of 25 mg granules taken orally every   12 hours with fat‑containing food   50 mg     7 kg to less   than 14 kg   One Kalydeco sachet   of 50 mg granules taken orally every 12 hours with fat-containing food    100 mg     14 kg to   less than 25 kg   One Kalydeco sachet   of 75 mg granules taken orally every 12 hours with fat-containing food    150 mg     25 kg or   more   Please refer   to Kalydeco tablets Package Leaflet

Element: If your child has liver problems, your child’s doctor may need to reduce the dose of Kalydeco as your child’s liver will not clear the medicine as fast as in children who have normal liver function.
Text: If your child has liver problems, your child’s doctor may need to reduce the dose of Kalydeco as your child’s liver will not clear the medicine as fast as in children who have normal liver function.

Element: · Moderate liver problems in children 6 months of age or older: the dose may be reduced to one half of the indicated dose in the table above, that is one sachet once daily.
Text: ·         Moderate liver problems in children 6 months of age or older: the dose may be reduced to one half of the indicated dose in the table above, that is one sachet once daily.

Element: · Severe liver problems in children 6 months of age or older: the use is not recommended but your child’s doctor will decide if it is appropriate for your child to use this medicine in which case the dose (as indicated in the table above) must be reduced to one sachet every other day.
Text: ·         Severe liver problems in children 6 months of age or older: the use is not recommended but your child’s doctor will decide if it is appropriate for your child to use this medicine in which case the dose (as indicated in the table above) must be reduced to one sachet every other day.

Element: · Liver problems in children between 4 months and 6 months of age: the use is not recommended but your child’s doctor will decide if it is appropriate for your child to use and what dose your child should have.
Text: ·         Liver problems in children between 4 months and 6 months of age: the use is not recommended but your child’s doctor will decide if it is appropriate for your child to use and what dose your child should have.

Element: Kalydeco is for oral use.
Text: Kalydeco is for oral use.

Element: Each sachet is for single use only.
Text: Each sachet is for single use only.

Element: Giving Kalydeco to your child:
Text: Giving Kalydeco to your child:

Element: · Hold sachet of granules with cut line on top.
Text: ·         Hold sachet of granules with cut line on top.

Element: · Shake sachet gently to settle contents.
Text: ·         Shake sachet gently to settle contents.

Element: · Tear or cut sachet open along cut line.
Text: ·         Tear or cut sachet open along cut line.

Element: · Mix the entire content of a sachet with 5 mL of age-appropriate soft food or liquid. Food or liquid should be at room temperature or below. Some examples of age-appropriate soft foods or liquids include puréed fruits or vegetables, yogurt, applesauce, water, milk, breast milk, infant formula, or juice.
Text: ·         Mix the entire content of a sachet with 5 mL of age-appropriate soft food or liquid. Food or liquid should be at room temperature or below. Some examples of age-appropriate soft foods or liquids include puréed fruits or vegetables, yogurt, applesauce, water, milk, breast milk, infant formula, or juice.

Element: · Once mixed, give the product to your child immediately. If this is not possible, give it within the following hour after mixing. Ensure that the mixture is completely and immediately consumed.
Text: ·         Once mixed, give the product to your child immediately. If this is not possible, give it within the following hour after mixing. Ensure that the mixture is completely and immediately consumed.

Element: · A fat-containing meal or snack should be given to your child just before or just after dosing (some examples are provided below).
Text: ·         A fat-containing meal or snack should be given to your child just before or just after dosing (some examples are provided below).

Element: Meals or snacks that contain fat include those prepared with butter or oils or those containing eggs. Other fat-containing foods are:
Text: Meals or snacks that contain fat include those prepared with butter or oils or those containing eggs. Other fat-containing foods are:

Element: · Cheese, whole milk, whole-milk dairy products, yogurt, breast milk, infant formula, chocolate
Text: ·         Cheese, whole milk, whole-milk dairy products, yogurt, breast milk, infant formula, chocolate

Element: · Meats, oily fish
Text: ·         Meats, oily fish

Element: · Avocados, hummus, soy-based products (tofu)
Text: ·         Avocados, hummus, soy-based products (tofu)

Element: · Nuts, fat-containing nutritional bars or drinks
Text: ·         Nuts, fat-containing nutritional bars or drinks

Element: If your child takes more Kalydeco than he/she should
Text: If your child takes more Kalydeco than he/she should

Element: Your child may experience side effects, including those mentioned in section 4 below. If so, contact your child’s doctor or pharmacist to ask for advice. If possible, have your child’s medicine and this leaflet with you.
Text: Your child may experience side effects, including those mentioned in section 4 below. If so, contact your child’s doctor or pharmacist to ask for advice. If possible, have your child’s medicine and this leaflet with you.

Element: If you forget to give your child Kalydeco
Text: If you forget to give your child Kalydeco

Element: Give the missed dose if less than 6 hours have passed since the time your child missed the dose. Otherwise, wait until your child’s next scheduled dose as you normally would. Do not give your child a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.
Text: Give the missed dose if less than 6 hours have passed since the time your child missed the dose. Otherwise, wait until your child’s next scheduled dose as you normally would. Do not give your child a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.

Element: If you stop giving your child Kalydeco
Text: If you stop giving your child Kalydeco

Element: Give Kalydeco to your child for as long as your child’s doctor recommends. Do not stop unless your child’s doctor advises you to. If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your child’s doctor or pharmacist.
Text: Give Kalydeco to your child for as long as your child’s doctor recommends. Do not stop unless your child’s doctor advises you to. If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your child’s doctor or pharmacist.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.              Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

Element: Serious side effects
Text: Serious side effects

Element: Stomach (abdominal) ache and increased liver enzymes in the blood.
Text: Stomach (abdominal) ache and increased liver enzymes in the blood.

Element: Possible signs of liver problems
Text: Possible signs of liver problems

Element: Increased liver enzymes in the blood are common in patients with CF. These may be signs of liver problems:
Text: Increased liver enzymes in the blood are common in patients with CF. These may be signs of liver problems:

Element: · Pain or discomfort in the upper right area of the stomach (abdominal) area
Text: ·         Pain or discomfort in the upper right area of the stomach (abdominal) area

Element: · Yellowing of the skin or white part of the eyes
Text: ·         Yellowing of the skin or white part of the eyes

Element: · Loss of appetite
Text: ·         Loss of appetite

Element: · Nausea or vomiting
Text: ·         Nausea or vomiting

Element: · Dark urine
Text: ·         Dark urine

Element: Tell your child’s doctor straight away if he/she gets any of these.
Text: Tell your child’s doctor straight away if he/she gets any of these.

Element: Very common side effects (may affect more than 1 in 10 people)
Text: Very common side effects (may affect more than 1 in 10 people)

Element: · Upper respiratory tract infection (the common cold), including sore throat and nasal congestion
Text: ·         Upper respiratory tract infection (the common cold), including sore throat and nasal congestion

Element: · Headache
Text: ·         Headache

Element: · Dizziness
Text: ·         Dizziness

Element: · Diarrhoea
Text: ·         Diarrhoea

Element: · Rash
Text: ·         Rash

Element: · Changes in the type of bacteria in mucus
Text: ·         Changes in the type of bacteria in mucus

Element: Common side effects (may affect up to 1 in 10 people)
Text: Common side effects (may affect up to 1 in 10 people)

Element: · Runny nose
Text: ·         Runny nose

Element: · Ear pain, ear discomfort
Text: ·         Ear pain, ear discomfort

Element: · Ringing in the ears
Text: ·         Ringing in the ears

Element: · Redness inside the ear
Text: ·         Redness inside the ear

Element: · Inner ear disorder (feeling dizzy or spinning)
Text: ·         Inner ear disorder (feeling dizzy or spinning)

Element: · Sinus congestion
Text: ·         Sinus congestion

Element: · Redness in the throat
Text: ·         Redness in the throat

Element: · Breast mass
Text: ·         Breast mass

Element: Uncommon side effects (may affect up to 1 in 100 people)
Text: Uncommon side effects (may affect up to 1 in 100 people)

Element: · Ear congestion
Text: ·         Ear congestion

Element: · Breast inflammation
Text: ·         Breast inflammation

Element: · Enlargement of the breast in males
Text: ·         Enlargement of the breast in males

Element: · Nipple changes or pain
Text: ·         Nipple changes or pain

Element: Additional side effects in children and adolescents
Text: Additional side effects in children and adolescents

Element: Side effects seen in children and adolescents are similar to those observed in adults. However, increased liver enzymes in the blood are more frequently seen in young children.
Text: Side effects seen in children and adolescents are similar to those observed in adults. However, increased liver enzymes in the blood are more frequently seen in young children.

Element: Reporting of side effects
Text: Reporting of side effects

Element: If your child gets any side effects, talk to your child’s doctor or pharmacist. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.
Text: If your child gets any side effects, talk to your child’s doctor or pharmacist. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Kalydeco
Text: 5.              How to store Kalydeco

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the package after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the package after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: This medicine does not require any special storage conditions.
Text: This medicine does not require any special storage conditions.

Element: Once mixed, the mixture has been shown to be stable for one hour.
Text: Once mixed, the mixture has been shown to be stable for one hour.

Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.
Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.

Text: What Kalydeco contains

Text: Kalydeco 25 mg granules in sachet:

Text: Kalydeco 75 mg granules in sachet:

Text: The active substance is ivacaftor. Each sachet contains 75 mg of ivacaftor.

Element: The other ingredients are: silica, colloidal anhydrous, croscarmellose sodium, hypromellose acetate succinate, lactose monohydrate, magnesium stearate, mannitol, sucralose and sodium laurilsulfate (E487).
Text: The other ingredients are: silica, colloidal anhydrous, croscarmellose sodium, hypromellose acetate succinate, lactose monohydrate, magnesium stearate, mannitol, sucralose and sodium laurilsulfate (E487).
